pr_title: fix security checks to make @RolesAllowed("**") work

timeline.message:
fix security checks to make @RolesAllowed("**") work

The correct wildcard to use seems to be `**`, because that's what
the Jakarta EE specifications use. More specifically:

- the EJB spec says that `**` means all roles
  (chapter 12.2.5.2 in EJB 3.2 Core spec)
- the Servlet spec says that `**` means all roles and `*` should
  never be used (chapter 13.3 in Servlet 4.0 spec)
- the JAX-RS specification doesn't seem to define this, but
  `QuarkusResteasySecurityContext.isUserInRole` already uses `**`

timeline.bodyText:
So do we support *?
If it's what we documented before, we should probably support it.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: It was in the documentation, but didn't work. ** is what used to work (and still works) on other places (such as isUserInRole), this commit just brings @RolesAllowed on par.
replies.author: Ladicek

timeline.bodyText: @Ladicek That looks fine, but do we also have to tweak smallrye-jwt code somewhere as you said it supports * ?
